LOS ANGELES DOCUMENT RETRIEVAL SUPPORT

Hall of Records
Document Retrieval.

When the portal doesn’t show enough detail, a retrieval bundle is the upgrade: request and package publicly available counter/records documents and attach them to your Permit Due Diligence Dossier.

Start the Dossier Text RETRIEVAL + ADDRESS

Retrieval timelines depend on counter hours/queues and document availability (often 2–5 business days)

What a retrieval bundle can include

✓
Permit cards / permit printouts (public)
✓
Inspection history pages (when publicly releasable)
✓
Correction notices / correction summaries (when available)
✓
Public attachments that counters can release
✓
Receipts + a document inventory list
Availability varies by jurisdiction. Some items require owner authorization or are restricted.

How PermitPulse packages it

✓
Request list confirmed up front (what you want pulled)
✓
Document inventory + page counts
✓
Scan quality check (readable, organized)
✓
Linked into the dossier so the story reads end-to-end
Agency printing/certification fees may apply and are billed at cost unless included in your package.

Most common reason people add retrieval

They need details the portal doesn’t show clearly: exact scope language, missing finals context, correction history, or supporting public attachments.

Choose a Dossier Package Need only the online report?

FAQ

Can you guarantee a specific document?

No. Counters and jurisdictions control what is available and releasable. If something is restricted, you’ll receive a clear “authorization needed” note and alternatives.

Is this the same as pulling full plans?

Not always. Plan sets are often restricted. Retrieval bundles focus on documents that are publicly available through the agency.
